settings.heading: Q: Who can sign up for a UTR Sports profile?
settings.row_content: A: Anyone can sign up and play tennis with UTR Sports for free.

settings.heading: Q: What are the benefits of UTR Sports to tennis players?
settings.row_content:
UTR Sports offers tennis players several key benefits:

1. Find Matches Easily: Quickly discover local matches, events, and tennis players at your skill level.

2. Accurate Skill Tracking: Track your tennis rating accurately with the industry-leading UTR Rating system.

3. Personalized Play: Enjoy tailored recommendations for tennis matches and tournaments based on your skill level and preferences.

4. Progress Insights: Get detailed analytics on your game performance to identify areas for improvement.

5. Join Competitive Events: Easily find and register for tournaments, leagues, and flex play opportunities in your area.

6. Community Connection: Connect with other tennis players, join clubs, and build your tennis network effortlessly.

Overall, UTR helps tennis players of all levels improve their game, find suitable opponents, and enjoy tennis more than ever before.

settings.heading: Q: Is the UTR Sports tennis profile free?
settings.row_content: A: Yes, you can sign up for a profile completely free. For additional benefits, consider our Power Subscription, which unlocks advanced features designed to help you easily find matches, track your skill level, and get more enjoyment out of your game.

settings.heading: Q: Who’s the app for?
settings.row_content: A: Everyone! UTR Sports streamlines the steps to get you on the court and competing with players is your level. Tennis will be at your fingertips—improve, connect, and enjoy the game.

settings.heading: Q. How do I register for and play a tennis event?
settings.row_content: A. Select what you are searching for: tennis tournaments, flex tennis leagues, etc. You can then narrow down your search by location, date range, event series, type, Verified Events, Prize Money, and more.

settings.heading: Q. What is a UTR Tennis Rating? Why should I have one?
settings.row_content:
A. A UTR Tennis Rating is a number that provides a real and accurate measurement of skill level. A player’s UTR Rating is a number between 1.00 and 16.50. 

One match result is all it takes to receive a projected UTR Rating. After approximately five matches, the rating becomes fully reliable. As matches are played and entered into the system, a player’s UTR Rating will increase or decrease over time to reflect their current skill level.

Watch the explainer video here.

settings.heading: Q. How is the UTR Tennis Rating calculated?
settings.row_content:
A. For each match, the algorithm calculates a match rating and a match weight for each player. A player’s UTR Rating is the weighted average of up to 30 of their most recent match ratings. Only matches within the last 12 months count toward a player’s UTR Rating.

Read detailed explanation here.

settings.heading: Q. What's the best way to improve my UTR Rating?
settings.row_content:
Play Well.
Performing well in matches is the easiest way to improve your UTR Rating. If the match is out of hand, don’t give up! It does not matter whether you play higher- or lower-rated opponents; you can improve your UTR Rating either way by winning more games than expected.

Play Often.
The more matches you play, the quicker your UTR Rating will reflect your current form. The algorithm is especially accurate for those who play often against a variety of opponents rated above and below you.

Be Patient.
Since your UTR Rating is a rolling weighted average, the effect of new results is slightly lagged. Your UTR Rating may not fully reflect a recent outcome right away, but it will over time.

Watch the video here.

settings.heading: Q. What events does UTR Sports offer?
settings.row_content: UTR Sports offers a variety of events on our platform including Flex League tennis, tennis tournaments (UTR PTT, Junior Circuits and more). Sign up to find local tennis events catered to your UTR rating.

settings.subtitle: The UTR Rating is the world’s most accurate tennis rating system. All players regardless of age, gender, geography or skill level, are rated on the same scale from 1 and 16.50 based on daily match results.
